meanings.sent1: The small team felt outmanned by the larger opponents.
meanings.sent2: The army was outmanned and had to retreat.
meanings.sent3: The tiny ants outmanned the big beetles in the race to the picnic crumbs.
meanings.sent4: The chess player strategically outmanned his opponent, even though he had fewer pieces.
meanings.sent5: The outnumbered knights were clearly outmanned by the enemy forces.

meanings.definition: To surpass in numbers; have more people than.
meanings.sent1: The school team managed to outmanned their rivals in the final game.
meanings.sent2: During the election, the winning party outmanned the others in supporters.
meanings.sent3: The birthday party outmanned the small living room, making it a cozy gathering.
meanings.sent4: The marathon runner outmanned his competitors, crossing the finish line first.
meanings.sent5: The company's growth allowed it to outmanned its competitors in the market.
